what: Load the xvm package and dependency packages
title: read and plot xpm file
text: Load xvm package: Load dependency packages:
code: # Load the xvm package library(xvm) #> Error in get(paste0(generic, ".", class), envir = get_method_env()) :  #>   object 'type_sum.accel' not found # Load dependency packages library(ggplot2)

previous_headings: Read a single xpm file and plot it.
title: read and plot xpm file
text: Retrieve path example file included package:
code: # This example file is an xpm file containing (free energy landscape, FEL) data generated by GROMACS gibbs_file_path <- system.file("extdata/gibbs.xpm", package = "xvm")

previous_headings: Read a single xpm file and plot it.
title: read and plot xpm file
text: imported xpm file stored list, can simply display data using str() function. list contains seven elements, storing different pieces information: $data: data frame containing xpm data. $title: main title. $legend: legend labels. $x_label: label x-axis. $y_label: label y-axis. $color_map: detailed information xpm file, including: $color_values: detailed information xpm file, including:
code: # Read the xpm file using read_xpm() function gibbs_data <- read_xpm(gibbs_file_path) #> Dimensions parsed: width = 32, height = 32, colors = 50  # The imported xpm file is stored as a list, with the list name corresponding to the file name. names(gibbs_data) #> [1] "gibbs.xpm" str(gibbs_data[[1]],max.level = 1) #> List of 7 #>  $ data        :'data.frame':    1024 obs. of  5 variables: #>   ..- attr(*, "out.attrs")=List of 2 #>  $ title       : chr "Gibbs Energy Landscape" #>  $ legend      : chr "G (kJ/mol)" #>  $ x_label     : chr "PC1" #>  $ y_label     : chr "PC2" #>  $ color_map   :List of 50 #>  $ color_values:List of 50

previous_headings: Read a single xpm file and plot it.
title: read and plot xpm file
code: # Plot the xpm data using plot_xpm() function plot_xpm(gibbs_data)

title: read and plot xpm file
text: read_xpm() function can accept multiple xpm file paths character vector.
code: # Similarly, you can also read multiple types of xpm files.  multi_file_path <- dir(system.file("extdata", package = "xvm"))  # Filter out xpm files using stringr package library(stringr) multi_file_path <- multi_file_path[str_detect(multi_file_path, ".xpm")] print(multi_file_path) #> [1] "entropy.xpm" "gibbs.xpm"  # Set the full xvg file paths multi_file_path <- file.path(system.file("extdata", package = "xvm"),                              multi_file_path                              )

title: read and plot xpm file
code: # Read multiple xpm files at once in batch: multi_data <- read_xpm(multi_file_path) #> Dimensions parsed: width = 32, height = 32, colors = 50 #>  #> Dimensions parsed: width = 32, height = 32, colors = 50 names(multi_data) #> [1] "entropy.xpm" "gibbs.xpm"

title: read and plot xpm file
text: can view information single xpm file indexing list:
code: # Check the first xpm file info via indexing str(multi_data[[1]],max.level = 1) #> List of 7 #>  $ data        :'data.frame':    1024 obs. of  5 variables: #>   ..- attr(*, "out.attrs")=List of 2 #>  $ title       : chr "Entropy Landscape" #>  $ legend      : chr "TDS (kJ/mol)" #>  $ x_label     : chr "PC1" #>  $ y_label     : chr "PC2" #>  $ color_map   :List of 50 #>  $ color_values:List of 50

title: read and plot xpm file
text: Alternatively, use lapply() generate plots xpm file:
code: # Use lapply() to plot all the xpm files in batch mutli_xpm_plots <- lapply(multi_data, plot_xpm)

title: read and plot xpm file
text: Finally, arrange plots single layout using ggarrange() function ggpubr package:
code: # Arrange the plots using ggpubr library(ggpubr) ggarrange(plotlist = mutli_xpm_plots)

title: read and plot xpm file
text: xpm files representing free energy landscapes, xvm also provides pseudo-3D plotting function plot_xpm_facet(). upper plot PC1 x axis, G (kJ/mol) y axis, color indicates distance PC2. lower plot PC2 x axis, G (kJ/mol) y axis, color represents distance PC1.
code: # Usage is similar to the plot_xpm() function plot_xpm_facet(gibbs_data)

what: Plot 3D scatter plot from xpm file
title: read and plot xpm file
text: xvm also provides 3D plotting function plot_xpm_3d() using plotly package.
code: # Usage is similar to the plot_xpm() function plot_xpm_3d(gibbs_data)

what: Load the xvm package and dependency packages
title: read and plot xvg file
text: Load xvm package: Load dependency packages:
code: # Load the xvm package library(xvm) #> Error in get(paste0(generic, ".", class), envir = get_method_env()) :  #>   object 'type_sum.accel' not found # Load dependency packages library(ggplot2)

previous_headings: Read a single xvg file and plot it.
title: read and plot xvg file
text: Retrieve path example file included package:
code: # This example file is an xvg file containing RMSD data generated by GROMACS rmsd_file_path <- system.file("extdata/rmsd.xvg", package = "xvm")

previous_headings: Read a single xvg file and plot it.
title: read and plot xvg file
text: imported xvg file stored list, can simply display data using str() function. list contains two elements, storing different pieces information: $data: data frame containing xvg data. $metadata: detailed information xvg file, including: title: main title. subtitle: subtitle. xaxis: label x-axis. yaxis: label y-axis. xaxis_formatted: x-axis label formatted support subscripts superscripts. yaxis_formatted: y-axis label formatted support subscripts superscripts. legends: legend labels. legends_formatted: formatted legend labels. file_path: path file located.
code: # Read the xvg file using read_xvg() function rmsd_data <- read_xvg(rmsd_file_path)  # The imported xvg file is stored as a list, with the list name corresponding to the file name. names(rmsd_data) #> [1] "rmsd.xvg" str(rmsd_data[[1]]) #> List of 2 #>  $ data    :'data.frame':    3334 obs. of  2 variables: #>   ..$ Time (ps): num [1:3334] 0 30 60 90 120 150 180 210 240 270 ... #>   ..$ RMSD (nm): num [1:3334] 0.000499 0.115534 0.127646 0.125452 0.123716 ... #>  $ metadata:List of 9 #>   ..$ title            : chr "RMSD" #>   ..$ subtitle         : chr "Backbone after lsq fit to Backbone" #>   ..$ xaxis            : chr "Time (ps)" #>   ..$ yaxis            : chr "RMSD (nm)" #>   ..$ xaxis_formatted  : chr "Time (ps)" #>   ..$ yaxis_formatted  : chr "RMSD (nm)" #>   ..$ legends          : chr(0)  #>   ..$ legends_formatted: Named list() #>   ..$ file_path        : chr "/private/var/folders/_b/gx4lc14d5ssf7pl9qlkl32r80000gn/T/RtmpZ9pDHb/temp_libpath3ad297c9d9c/xvm/extdata/rmsd.xvg"

previous_headings: Read a single xvg file and plot it.
title: read and plot xvg file
code: # Plot the xvg data using plot_xvg() function plot_xvg(rmsd_data)

title: read and plot xvg file
text: read_xvg() function can accept multiple xvg file paths character vector.
code: # Similarly, you can also read multiple types of xvg files.  multi_file_path <- dir(system.file("extdata", package = "xvm"))  # Filter out xvg files using stringr package library(stringr) multi_file_path <- multi_file_path[str_detect(multi_file_path, ".xvg")] print(multi_file_path) #> [1] "rmsd.xvg" "rmsf.xvg"  # Set the full xvg file paths multi_file_path <- file.path(system.file("extdata", package = "xvm"),                              multi_file_path                              )

title: read and plot xvg file
code: # Read multiple xvg files at once in batch: multi_data <- read_xvg(multi_file_path) names(multi_data) #> [1] "rmsd.xvg" "rmsf.xvg"

title: read and plot xvg file
text: can view information single xvg file indexing list:
code: # Check the first xvg file info via indexing str(multi_data[[1]]) #> List of 2 #>  $ data    :'data.frame':    3334 obs. of  2 variables: #>   ..$ Time (ps): num [1:3334] 0 30 60 90 120 150 180 210 240 270 ... #>   ..$ RMSD (nm): num [1:3334] 0.000499 0.115534 0.127646 0.125452 0.123716 ... #>  $ metadata:List of 9 #>   ..$ title            : chr "RMSD" #>   ..$ subtitle         : chr "Backbone after lsq fit to Backbone" #>   ..$ xaxis            : chr "Time (ps)" #>   ..$ yaxis            : chr "RMSD (nm)" #>   ..$ xaxis_formatted  : chr "Time (ps)" #>   ..$ yaxis_formatted  : chr "RMSD (nm)" #>   ..$ legends          : chr(0)  #>   ..$ legends_formatted: Named list() #>   ..$ file_path        : chr "/private/var/folders/_b/gx4lc14d5ssf7pl9qlkl32r80000gn/T/RtmpZ9pDHb/temp_libpath3ad297c9d9c/xvm/extdata/rmsd.xvg"

title: read and plot xvg file
code: # Plot one of the xvg files using the plot_xvg() function: plot_xvg(multi_data[[1]])

title: read and plot xvg file
text: Alternatively, use lapply() generate plots xvg file:
code: # Use lapply() to plot all the xvg files in batch mutli_xvg_plots <- lapply(multi_data, plot_xvg)

title: read and plot xvg file
text: Finally, arrange plots single layout using ggarrange() function ggpubr package:
code: # Arrange the plots using ggpubr library(ggpubr) ggarrange(plotlist = mutli_xvg_plots)

title: Authors and Citation
text: BeiHao Li. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Li B (2025). xvm: Read, Parse Visualize 'XVG'/'XPM' Files Molecular Dynamics. R package version 0.0.2, https://rightsz.github.io/xvm/, https://github.com/RightSZ/xvm.
code: @Manual{,   title = {xvm: Read, Parse and Visualize 'XVG'/'XPM' Files from Molecular Dynamics},   author = {BeiHao Li},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.2, https://rightsz.github.io/xvm/},   url = {https://github.com/RightSZ/xvm}, }

what: Read, Parse and Visualize XVG/XPM Files from Molecular Dynamics
title: Read, Parse and Visualize XVG/XPM Files from Molecular Dynamics
text: xvm R package provides tools reading, parsing, visualizing output files xvg xpm formats, typically generated simulation software GROMACS. xvm designed streamline post-processing analysis molecular dynamics (MD) simulation data. xvm, users can easily import trajectory data (e.g., RMSD, energy, temperature) generate publication-quality plots. Targeted researchers computational chemistry, biophysics, structural biology, xvm bridges gap raw MD outputs actionable insights, enabling efficient exploration molecular stability conformational changes. Find https://github.com/RightSZ/xvm

title: Read, Parse and Visualize XVG/XPM Files from Molecular Dynamics
text: install latest version GitHub follow:
code: # Install from CRAN install.packages("xvm")  # Install the development version from GitHub if(!require(devtools)) install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("RightSZ/xvm")

title: Read, Parse and Visualize XVG/XPM Files from Molecular Dynamics
code: # Load the xvm package library(xvm)  # This example file is an xvg file containing RMSD data generated by GROMACS rmsd_file_path <- system.file("extdata/rmsd.xvg", package = "xvm")  # Read the xvg file using read_xvg() function rmsd_data <- read_xvg(rmsd_file_path)  # The imported xvg file is stored as a list, with the list name corresponding to the file name. names(rmsd_data)  # Plot the xvg data using plot_xvg() function plot_xvg(rmsd_data)

title: Read, Parse and Visualize XVG/XPM Files from Molecular Dynamics
code: # This example file is an xpm file containing (free energy landscape, FEL) data generated by GROMACS gibbs_file_path <- system.file("extdata/gibbs.xpm", package = "xvm")  # Read the xpm file using read_xpm() function gibbs_data <- read_xpm(gibbs_file_path)  # The imported xpm file is stored as a list, with the list name corresponding to the file name. names(gibbs_data)  # Plot the xpm data using plot_xpm() function plot_xpm(gibbs_data)

title: format special text — format_text
text: processes special formatting xvg files, converting super/subscripts ggplot2-compatible expressions. Specifically handles: Superscripts: Converts \S...\N ^ notation Subscripts: Converts \s...\N [] notation

title: format special text — format_text
code: format_text(text)

title: format special text — format_text
text: text character string containing xvg-formatted text

title: format special text — format_text
text: formatted character string ggplot2-compatible expressions

code: merge_xvg_data(xvg_data)

title: Merge Multiple XVG Data Objects — merge_xvg_data
text: merged XVG data object : data - Combined data frame additional 'group' column identifying source metadata - Metadata first object list

text: xpm_content character string containing xpm file content.

title: parse xpm (X PixMap) file content into structured data — parse_xpm
text: list following components: data - Data frame containing matrix values coordinates title - Chart title extracted xpm legend - Legend text extracted xpm x_label - X-axis label extracted xpm y_label - Y-axis label extracted xpm color_map - Named list mapping color codes hex values color_values - Named list mapping color codes numeric values

code: parse_xvg(lines, skip_comments = TRUE)

text: lines character vector text lines xvg file skip_comments logical indicating whether skip comment lines (default: TRUE)

title: parse xvg File Content — parse_xvg
text: list containing xvg data metadata following structure: data - Data frame containing numerical data metadata - List containing title, axis labels, legends formatted versions

title: plot xvg data — plot_xvg
text: xvg_data xvg data object returned read_xvg merge logical; TRUE multiple datasets provided, merge (default: FALSE) title chart title (default uses xvg file's title) subtitle chart subtitle (default uses xvg file's subtitle) use_color_scale custom color scale function (e.g., ggsci::scale_color_bmj) override default colors ... additional parameters passed ggplot2::geom_line

text: ggplot2 object

title: read xpm files — read_xpm
text: function reads xpm (X PixMap) files, validates existence, returns parsed data structures list format.

title: read xpm files — read_xpm
code: read_xpm(xpm_files)

title: read xpm files — read_xpm
text: xpm_files character vector containing paths one xpm files.

title: read xpm files — read_xpm
text: list following components: data - Data frame containing matrix values coordinates title - Chart title extracted xpm legend - Legend text extracted xpm x_label - X-axis label extracted xpm y_label - Y-axis label extracted xpm color_map - Named list mapping color codes hex values color_values - Named list mapping color codes numeric values

title: read xpm files — read_xpm
text: function performs following operations: Validates input type (must character vector) Checks file existence filters missing files warnings Reads valid files parses using parse_xpm() Returns aggregated results named list

title: read xpm files — read_xpm
code: # \donttest{ library(xvm) # Retrieve the path to the example file included in the package xpm_file_path <- system.file("extdata/gibbs.xpm", package = "xvm") xpm_data <- read_xpm(xpm_file_path) # read the xpm file using read_xpm() function #> Dimensions parsed: width = 32, height = 32, colors = 50 names(xpm_data) #> [1] "gibbs.xpm" # }

code: read_xvg(xvg_files, skip_comments = TRUE)

text: xvg_files character vector xvg file paths skip_comments logical indicating whether skip comment lines (default: TRUE)

title: read xvg files — read_xvg
text: Named list containing xvg data, using filenames (without extension) keys
